author: Len Parks
comment: Luv this app! The only improvement I can see is that sharing to Instagram Direct seams a waste of time, why not make it so we can share directly to our profile.  We also need a way to post our shoes for cycling in the Gear section, we can do our bikes and addons to that but no shoes. How do you stop automatic upload of our rides?

author: Jorge Proença
comment: Good app, but more sports should be added to the weekly and global statistics such as walking and hiking. A great number of people ask for it and Strava does not say anything about it.  Also, the community is asking for a long time to have MiBand 2 support and they don't care enough to provide it.

author: Adam Ball
comment: Need to revert to chronological view please.  Ive had to unfollow a few people because their activities dominate the top of the feed despite being weeks old. Good that the "suggested follows" section is much less frequent now. Good to see they got rid of the PR on first attempt as well.

author: James Fox
comment: Only ever had one problem with this app, the beacon wouldn't work. It sent the link absolutely fine but there was no data to go with it. A quick exchange of e-mails later and it's sorted (my phone was connected to Wi-Fi when attempting to send the beacon, disconnect that and connect to mobile data instead and it works fine). The premium membership has helped with my motivation to go out on the rides I don't really fancy because of the targets you can set.

author: Mark Daniels
comment: I like this app, but it would be nice if you could track a few more activities: walking, for example. I do a lot of walking and kayaking. You can log such activities manually, but that's not as accurate as if you were to track properly. Surely it can't be that hard to put in some more options?

author: Zulkhairi Zuhoori
comment: Hey people, keep on working out and keep sweating. You don't need this app to tell you how far u went only to find out it didn't capture your effort. Just go out n do it. Strava is inaccurate and unreliable. Not for me I guess.

Never been able to record a full training session as always throws an error and stops recording. Very frustrating. Numerous updates have not fixed problem. Have been through all support docs and forums with no resolution. Looks to have good features but if cant use them it is pointless.

author: Aditya Nadkarni
comment: Fantastic as long as it works. After the update in the last week of February 2018, it's just got messed up. I've lost 175 km of hard cycling in the last 3 days because it didn't record. Was thinking of going premium this month, but changed my plan.

author: Nicolas Morales
comment: Apps been working great but about a month its stopped tracking. Ran the 5 mile race only for strava to count me running for 1 minute. Also been biking and it only records that ive moved but not the path

author: Maria de Sanchez
comment: Since last update it is NOT syncing with my Garmin. If it continues like this I will have to uninstall the app. It is sad because all this time it was working excellent. I never understand why something that is working good you people have to break it. Sad sad

author: Michael Busiko
comment: It seems the annoying ads are gone now. Thanks for listening Strava. Just one star off because now my android wear app won't get a GPS fix anymore.
Went from 5 star to no star. Last dozon times I've used it, it didn't record distance nor record route.  Bad show.what!

author: Sriram Durga
comment: The app let's you sign up even though you provide an existing account's email address, and the worst part being that in doing so, it erases all your history. It's a bug, a major glitch, this might be affecting only free users, but the good reviews from such users is what has made Strava this popular. I lost all my activity history (a solid 3 years) because of this glitch.

author: Mali Pusa
comment: I have both Zephyr regular bluetooth heart rate monitor and Garmin premium ant+ heart rate monitor that don't connect to my stava app on my Samsung S8+. Also automatic workouts uploads to Facebook does not work even after I check box saying automatically upload new workouts on website and blue color facebook sign is marked on app as explained on support forum. All of this maybe because I am free member. I connected strava with Zwift,  Zwift with Bkool and strava with Endomondo since in Endomondo all of above problems works fine.

author: Greg Lawrence
comment: I hate the new non-chronological feed. Please give us the option to change it.

author: Warren Smith
comment: Everytime I refresh my feed it keeps saying I have 1 new notification but it's actually an old one. This is having consistently.

author: Yannick Drapela
comment: the app is ok. I do not use the tracking feature (gps watch). It misses a decent amount of features that are available on the website. some make sense, like route building, which is probably difficult to offer on mobile. others are not understandable, like training plans. you can't even look at your current plan, and it is a "premium" feature. Also there is (globally) no option to hide HR and/or power data from the public. A feature request exists since couple of years for this but nobody cares. These reasons let me to cancel my premium subscription.

author: Jon Salisbury
comment: A great app for keeping track of your activities... and friends activities... wherever they live in the world! Really motivating. Clubs is a useful feature but it would be so much better if the data could be accessed and interrogated to find out who has completed the most miles in a specific time period for example. This would raise the bar to 5 stars!

author: bhushan chari
comment: Good app but it closes automatically in the background few min after i leave the app.  it restarts whn i open but i loose all my data.  Please fix it

author: Bizo Bravo
comment: This app just doesn't work quiet as nicely on the Samsung S8 (works accurately on the iPhone) whereas on the Android device it just draws a straight line from point A to point B. Or maybe I might be getting the settings wrong??

author: seshireddy nangu
comment: Not tracking properly. Enabled GPS and mobile data and started recording the of cycling. I did cycling for an hour about 8 km but it recorded only .7 km.

author: charan siddesh
comment: The app closes suddenly and when I try to open I'll get a pop msg tat Strava has stopped working and it Ll resume ur recording now. All the data Ll be lost.

author: Isha Lamboo
comment: Used the app for about 3 weeks to track my cycling and it worked well. Then it started sending me stuff from obvious fake/paid users to lure me to premium. The maker apparently doesn't respect its customers, so I won't trust them with my data.

author: John Kipp
comment: Latest update broke sync with Garmin. I've uninstalled and reinstalled, rebooted the phone and watch...no joy. It does not work.

author: Tejas Fadadu
comment: Make leader board for A month. Only a week is not satisfactory. Take reference from Endomondo. Make live workout in free version.

author: Benjamin Kamginlal Lunkim
comment: F**king app stopped while I'm running and app my progress is lost.this isn't the first time.

author: Santosh Reddi
comment: GPS tracking problem after the recent update

author: Arnetta Davis
comment: Love the app. I think that audible mile notification would be a great asset.

author: Pius Dias
comment: GPS signal stops on mi 4i

author: Harold Ball
comment: It would be nice to have heart rate zones and alarms to let you know when you are exceeding your HR limit.

author: Jesus Vera
comment: Did not keep track of my runs at all. Do not recommend. Immediately uninstalling.

author: Graeme McArthur
comment: Doesnt work properly on Android Oreo

author: J Marsh
comment: Needs a dark theme

author: K Law
comment: Works for me. 😊

author: MAG SINGH
comment: Great great great great

author: PANKAJ KUMAR YADAV
comment: Gps will not work properly

author: David Graham
comment: Nice folks to have tracking me...

author: Kathir Vel
comment: Love It

author: Ashok Karumuri
comment: I use this wonderful free app for documenting the statistics of  my bike rides, and on my rare jogs. A minor issue is that it fails to record, and goes to finish screen. It happened today, and I had to manually add my data. I reinstalled it just now, and hope that it doesn't happen again. The app also has problems on tracking slow walks. But given that everyone uses it, it is also a great way to see how our peers and friends do, and get inspired. I wish that the company offers the paid version more cheaply in India. It will get many customers.

author: Daniel Tse
comment: Cycling takes on a whole new dimension with Strava. You don't have to ride with your friends, but you can still challenge them. You can assess your own progress and identify areas of improvement. Best of all, you have this cycling biographer always by your side, noting down your every struggle and your every accomplishment, making sure your unforgettable ride truly is unforgettable! As with all apps, there are a few bugs here and there, but overall, Strava receives a massive thumbs up from me.
